job.title: Data Scientist I
job.description:
Interprets and applies data analytics to provide recommendations to the business.
Accountabilities
Develops and executes statistical and mathematical solutions to business problems
Frame problem, determine intended approach and recommend quantitative methods to develop solution
Use analytical rigor and statistical methods to analyze large amounts of data, culling actionable insights using advanced statistical techniques such as predictive statistical models, customer profiling, segmentation analysis, survey design and analysis and data mining
Design experiments to answer targeted questions
Document projects including business objective, data gathering and processing, leading approaches, final algorithm, detailed set of results and analytical metrics
Develops materials to explain project findings to management
Develops new algorithms and mathematical approaches to understand Kohl's audiences and solves complex business problems such as optimizing product performance, revenue and adoption
Identify and drive continuous improvement of key business metrics in assigned business functional area
Drive adoption and usage of analytical products and models
Think in terms of iterative development, document, and communicate throughout products data science lifecycle
Build and validate models
Qualifications
Experience developing custom models based on in-depth understanding of underlying data, data structures, and business problems to ensure analytics deliverables meet stakeholders need
Experience developing state of the art algorithms using machine learning, statistical and optimization methods to power various aspects of highly complex business models
Experience using modern analytics tools and languages such as Python, R, Spark, SQL (BigQuery), etc
Strong problem solving skills with an emphasis on product development
Experience proposing rapid experiments to test the effect of new strategies or initiatives, and iterate quickly
Required
2+ years of progressively complex Data Science or analytics experience
BS in Data Science, Computer Science, Machine Learning, Applied Mathematics, or equivalent quantitative field
Spark, Python, R proficiency
Preferred
Masters degree
Retail experience
Supply chain management
Marketing models
Logistics experience
req# : R202294
